SatTCR is a [Snakemake](https://snakemake.readthedocs.io/en/stable/) pipeline for assembling T Cell Receptor (TCR) repertoire data by using [MIXCR](https://mixcr.com/), and perform a saturation analysis.

## TCR profiling

Profiling the TCR repertoire using next-generation sequencing (NGS) to quantify adaptive immune responses has become common in human and animal research. TCR counts from NGS data provide a way to quantify T cell response to vaccines, cancer, or infectious diseases for preclinical and clinical health studies. 

## SatTCR modules

SatTCR is composed by 4 modules described in the image below:

- [Quality control](pipeline.qmd#quality-control): QC diagnostics of the sequencing data.

- [Clonotype assembly](pipeline.qmd#clonotype-assembly-with-mixcr): Assembly using MIXCR

- [Saturation analysis](pipeline.qmd#saturation-analysis): Sequential bootstrapping of the sequencing data to assembly clonotypes with a fixed # of sequencing reads.

- [Report of SatTCR results](pipeline.qmd#reporting-sattcr-results)
